columns.text: In this exercise, we are going to learn about equity as an option using Black Scholes Model and net present value.

To start with, let us define  Black Scholes Model. 

**Black Scholes Model** is a mathematical equation that involves probabilities to compute the price of an option. 

The equation of the Black Scholes Model is illustrated as follows: 

$$\textbf{C}=\text{S}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d1})}-\text{X}\times\text{e}^{\text{-rt}}\times\text{N}_{\text{(d2)}}$$

Where: 

- C- Call Option
- S- Stock Price
- X - Exercise Price
- r - rate
- t - time
- N(d1) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d1
- N(d2) - Probability if z is less than or equal to d2

Whereas d1 is solved as follows: 

$$\textbf{d}_{1}=\frac{\left[\text{ln}\frac{\text{S}}{\text{X}}\right]+\left(\text{r}+\frac{σ^2}{2}\right)\times\text{t}}{\left(σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}\right)}$$

And d2's equation is illustrated below: 

$$\textbf{d}_{2}=\text{d}_{1}-σ\times\sqrt{\text{t}}$$

Where: 

- σ - Standard deviation
- ln - natural logarithm

## Requirement A

We are asked to solve the combined value of equity and debt of Sunburn Sunscreen and Frostbite Thermal wear.

### Sunburn Sunscreen

Here are the parameters to solve the problem : 


|Given | | 
|--|--| 
| Stock price (S) |$16,200 | 
| Exercise price (X) |$15,000 | 
|Risk-free rate (r) | 6% | 
|Time (t) |1 year | 
|Standard deviation(σ) | 34% per year| 
| e| 2.71828|

To start with, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the current stock price and the exercise price. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 

!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/1ba9e8e6-aa61-49f0-9b31-89524e85c773-1661762225119361.png)


Therefore ln(S/X) is 0.077.

Next, let us solve d1 using the equation in Step 3: 


 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0.077+\left[0.06+\frac{0.34^2}{2}\right]\times1}{0.34\sqrt{1}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.077+\left[0.06+\frac{0.1156}{2}\right]\times1}{0.34\times1}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.077+\left[0.06+0.0578\right]\times1}{0.34}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.077+\left(0.1178\times1\right)}{0.34}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.077+0.1178}{0.34}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1948}{0.34}\\[20pt]
&=0.5729
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 0.5729.

Now, we solve the value of d2 using the equation in Step 3: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{2}&=0.5729-0.34\times\sqrt{1}\\[15pt]
&=0.5729-0.34\times1\\[15pt]
&=0.5729-0.34\\[15pt]
&=0.2329
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of d2 is 0.2329.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.7166 | 
|Nd2 |0.5920 |

Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=\$16,200\times0.7166-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)(1)}\times0.5920\\[15pt]
&=\$16,200\times0.7166-\$15,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)}\times0.5920\\[15pt]
&=\$16,200\times0.7166-\$15,000\times0.9418\times0.5920\\[15pt]
&=\$16,200\times0.7166-\$15,000\times0.5575\\[15pt]
&=\$11,609-\$8,363\\[15pt]
&=\$3,246
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the call option or the firm's equity is $3,246.

Lastly, the value of debt is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Debt}&=\text{Asset's Value}-\text{Equity}\\[15pt]
&=\$16,200-\$3,246\\[15pt]
&=\$12,954
\end{aligned}$$

The computed value of equity is deducted from the asset's value to determine the value of debt. 

Thus, the value of debt is $12,954.

### Frostbite Thermalwear

Here are the parameters to solve the problem : 


|Given | | 
|--|--| 
|Market value of asset (S) |$26,200 | 
| Face value of debt (X) |$23,000 | 
|Risk-free rate (r) | 6% | 
|Time (t) |1 year | 
|Standard deviation(σ) | 38% per year| 
| e| 2.71828|

To start with, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the current stock price and the exercise price. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 


!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/31548b61-b81e-4766-a040-a45aa62faedb-1661774273289882.png)

Therefore ln(S/X) is 0.1303.

Next, let us solve d1 using the equation in Step 3: 


 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0.1303+\left[0.06+\frac{0.38^2}{2}\right]\times1}{0.38\sqrt{1}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1303+\left[0.06+\frac{0.1444}{2}\right]\times1}{0.38\times1}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1303+\left[0.06+0.0722\right]\times1}{0.38}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1303+\left[0.1322\times1\right]}{0.38}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1303+0.1322}{0.38}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.2625}{0.38}\\[20pt]
&=0.6908
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 0.6908.

Now, we solve the value of d2 using the equation in Step 3: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{2}&=0.6908-0.38\times\sqrt{1}\\[15pt]
&=0.6908-0.38\times1\\[15pt]
&=0.6908-0.38\\[15pt]
&=0.3108
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of d2 is 0.3108.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.7551 | 
|Nd2 |0.6220 |

Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=\$26,200\times0.7551-\$23,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)(1)}\times0.6220\\[15pt]
&=\$26,200\times0.7551-\$23,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)}\times0.6220\\[15pt]
&=\$26,200\times0.7551-\$23,000\times0.9418\times0.6220\\[15pt]
&=\$26,200\times0.7551-\$23,000\times0.5858\\[15pt]
&=\$19,784-\$13,473\\[15pt]
&=\$6,311
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the call option or the firm's equity is $6,311.

Then, the value of debt is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{Debt}&=\text{Asset's Value}-\text{Equity}\\[15pt]
&=\$26,200-\$6,311\\[15pt]
&=\$19,889
\end{aligned}$$

The computed value of equity is deducted from the asset's value to determine the value of debt. 

Thus, the value of the debt is $19,889.

Now, the values of equity and debt are summarized below: 


| |Sunburn Sunscreen |Frostbite Thermalwear | 
|--|--|--| 
|Equity |$3,246 |$6,311 | 
|Debt |$12,954 |$19,889 |

## Requirement 2

We are required to solve the value of the new firm's equity and debt.

To start with, let us solve the total market value of the firm's assets (S) of Sunburn and Frostbite: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{S}&=\$16,200+\$26,200\\[15pt]
&=\$42,400
\end{aligned}$$

The market value of the assets of Sunburn and Frostbite are added to determine the total market value of assets. 

Thus, the total market value of assets is $42,400.

Next, let us solve the total face value of debt (X) of Sunburn and Frostbite: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{X}&=\$15,000+\$23,000\\[15pt]
&=\$38,000
\end{aligned}$$

The face value of debts of Sunburn and Frostbite are added to determine the total face value of debt. 

Thus, the total face value of the debt is $38,000.

After solving the total values, let us solve the natural logarithm of the quotient of the current market value of the asset and the face value of debt. 

We are going to use excel to solve the natural logarithm. The formula should look as follows: 


!['slader'](https://slader-solution-uploads.s3.amazonaws.com/b2d68d39-06e2-49b6-abd2-bd5faa1ac804-1661781030346289.png)

Therefore ln(S/X) is 0.1096.

The combined firm's return on assets has a standard deviation of 21%. 

Using the equation in Step 3, d1 is solved as follows: 

 
$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{1}&=\frac{0.1096+\left[0.06+\frac{0.21^2}{2}\right]\times1}{0.21\sqrt{1}}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1096+\left[0.06+\frac{0.0441}{2}\right]\times1}{0.21\times1}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1096+\left[0.06+0.02205\right]\times1}{0.21}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1096+\left(0.08205\times1\right)}{0.21}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.1096+0.08205}{0.21}\\[20pt]
&=\frac{0.19165}{0.21}\\[20pt]
&=0.9126
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, d1 is 0.9126.

Now, we solve the value of d2 using the equation in Step 3: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{d}_{2}&=0.9126-0.21\times\sqrt{1}\\[15pt]
&=0.9126-0.21\times1\\[15pt]
&=0.9126-0.21\\[15pt]
&=0.7026
\end{aligned}$$

Thus, the value of d2 is 0.7026.

Now, here are the values of N(d1) and N(d2) using the cumulative normal distribution table: 


|Normal distribution | | 
|--|--| 
|Nd1 |0.81855 | 
|Nd2 |0.7580 |

Using the equation in Step 2, the value of the call option is solved below: 

 

$$\begin{aligned}
\textbf{C}&=\$42,400\times0.81855-\$38,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)(1)}\times0.7580\\[15pt]
&=\$42,400\times0.81855-\$38,000\times2.71828^{-(0.06)}\times0.7580\\[15pt]
&=\$42,400\times0.81855-\$38,000\times0.9418\times0.7580\\[15pt]
&=\$42,400\times0.81855-\$38,000\times0.7139\\[15pt]
&=\$34,707-\$27,128\\[15pt]
&=\boxed{\$7,579}
\end{aligned}$$

Therefore, the value of the new firm's equity is $7,579.

## Requirement C

We are required to solve the gain or loss of shareholders and bondholders.

## Requirement D

We are asked to determine the effect on shareholder value. 

From the computed figures on Requirement C, the loss of shareholders is equal to the gain of the bondholders. Generally, a lower standard deviation decreases equity as well. Thus, a lower standard deviation generates a lower value of equity.

 The shareholder value declines, however, the bondholders gain, so the probability of the new firm repaying the debt is high.
